column4: why when i use firefox to see the page http://ndweb.iis.sinica.edu.tw/archaeo2_public/Include/GetImage_FileName.jsp?filename=R024974ccwa&type=3, i get a big image, and when i try to read it with wget, i get a small image ?
the page might be sending you a different image?
it's amazing, isn't it ?
how to download the big image with a command line then ?
Try giving it the same user agent string
what do you mean ?
Every browswer sends information about what program it is to the website
You need to send the same user agent string that firefox sends with wget
how to know this user agent ?
it seems that tcpdump could do the job but i don't understand how to use it...
I know there's a way to specify it.  Try reading the man pages?
yes I'm trying, but I don't get it

I tried the command 'wget --user-agent=""  http://ndweb.iis.sinica.edu.tw/archaeo2_public/Include/GetImage_FileName.jsp?filename=R024974ccwa&type=3' to download the big jpeg file, but still it download the small one, could you help me to make this work ?
try setting the useragent equal to:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.8) Gecko/20051202 Ubuntu/1.4.99+1.5rc3.dfsg-1ubuntu4 Firefox/1.5
no, it still downloads the small file
Hmm.  Visit this web site
http://www.cambiaresearch.com/cambia3/myuseragent/

i tried with my user-agent (Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; zh-CN; rv:1.7.12) Gecko/20051010 Firefox/1.0.7 (Ubuntu package 1.0.7)), but the result is the same, it doesn't work, the problem looks to come from somewhere else
I'm out of ideas, sorry. :(
is there another command than wget that could be more efficient ?
I'm not really sure...
